borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason:  To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004).

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:786/EIA/SU-100, 786/EIA/PP-100 Rev A, 786/EIA/PP-101 and 786/EIA/PP-200.Reason:  For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those in the existing building.Reason:  To ensure the development respects the appearance of the existing property and to maintain the amenity of the area in accordance with policies BP8 and BP11 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document.

The car and cycle parking areas indicated on drawing No. 786/EIA/PP-100 Rev A shall be constructed and marked out prior to the occupation of the development and thereafter retained permanently for the accommodation of vehicles and cycles of occupiers and visitors to the premises and not used for any other purpose.Reason:  To ensure that an off-street parking space is provided for a disabled person and in the interests of promoting cycling as a sustainable and non-polluting mode of transport and in accordance with policies BP11 and BR11 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document.

The development hereby permitted shall not be commenced until a scheme for protecting neighbouring occupiers from noise from the place of worship has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  All works which form part of the scheme shall be completed before the approved development is occupied.Reason:  To maintain reasonable levels of protection for neighbouring occupiers from noise and disturbance in accordance with policy BP8 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document.

The permitted use of the premises shall not take place other than between the hours of 7:00am and 10:00pm unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  These permitted hours shall come into effect immediately following the granting of planning permission.Reason:  To prevent the use causing any undue disturbance to occupants of neighbouring properties at unreasonable hours and in accordance with policy BP8 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document.
description: Alterations to mosque involving erection of single storey rear extension, construction of basement to rear and pitched roof to existing side extension.
